en.av_c1: Here is the process for inserting a new value into a heap.
en.av_c2: We put the new value at the rightmost leaf node. This ensures that the heap maintains the shape of a complete binary tree.
en.av_c3: Now we have to start moving the value upward in the heap, as appropriate. Since this is a max heap, we compare the new value to its parent. If it is greater than its parent, we swap them.
en.av_c4: We continue this process of comparing and swapping until the new value is in the correct position.
en.av_c5: 99 is now at the root of the heap, and it is greater than all of its descendants, so the insert is complete.
